trade something ↔ in.translation[0].defi: to give something such as a car to the person you are buying a new one from, as part of the payment
He traded his old car in for a new model.
trade something ↔ in.translation[1].defi: a used car, piece of equipment etc that you give to a seller of a new one that you are buying as part of the payment
Are you going to give your Ford as a trade-in?
trade something ↔ in.translation[2].defi: to give something, such as a car, as part of the payment for something you are buying
The Toyota dealer only offered him $4,000 to trade it in.
trade something ↔ in.translation[3].defi: a way of buying a new car, computer etc in which you give the seller your old car etc as part of the payment
A dealer may accept old equipment as a trade-in on a new computer.
They can’t afford a new car because thetrade-in value of the old one has dropped so much.
